Class ActuatorTransformGroup

All Implemented Interfaces:
EnableTarget
Direct Known Subclasses:
AffineGroup, AxisAngleSphereGroup, CenterAffineGroup, ConstantSizeGroup, DisplayFaceGroup, OrbitGroup, RotationSphereGroup, WorldOverlayGroup
public abstract class ActuatorTransformGroup
extends ActuatorGroup

An abstract base class for an ActuatorGroup based on a chain of transform groups.

The transforms in this group are for single-user use and should not be accessed or manipulated externally.

Constructor Detail

ActuatorTransformGroup

public ActuatorTransformGroup(javax.media.j3d.TransformGroup[] chain,
                              int length,
                              javax.media.j3d.Node child)
Constructs a ActuatorTransformGroup with the specified chain array. The groups in the chain are assumed to exist and to be connected in a parent-child chain.

Parameters:
chain - Chain array. Null if none.
length - Number of groups actually used in the chain. If 0 this group will be the head and tail.
child - First child node of this group. Null if none.

ActuatorTransformGroup

public ActuatorTransformGroup(int length,
                              javax.media.j3d.Node child)
Constructs a ActuatorTransformGroup with a default chain of TransformGroup.

Parameters:
length - Number of groups in chain. If this group will be the head and tail.
child - First child node of this group. Null if none.
Method Detail

buildChain

public javax.media.j3d.Group[] buildChain(int length)
Description copied from class: GroupChain
Called during construction to build a default group chain of the specified length. Override to build a more specific default group chain. The returned chain must be complete with groups connected in a parent-child chain. If the length is zero a null chain should be returned.

Overrides:
buildChain in class GroupChain
Parameters:
length - Number of groups in the chain. If 0 then return a null chain.

getTransform

protected javax.media.j3d.TransformGroup getTransform(int index)
Gets the transform at the specified index. This is a personal method to help avoid accidental corruption of the transform chain state.

Parameters:
index - Transform index (0 = head, length-1 = tail).
Returns:
The specified transform. Null if is invalid or there are no transforms.
